design_description: Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647
WGA

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.
WGA

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

RNA-Seq
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

RNA and DNA library construction for RNA and whole-exome DNA sequencing was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions using the Illumina TruSeq RNA sample preparation V2 and Nextera rapid capture exome kits, respectively. Sequencing was completed on the Illumina HiSeq 2000 according to the manufacturer's instructions. :: PMID: 34939322

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics) with a custom amplicon panel targeting 25 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supporting Information Table S1). The quality of the libraries was assessed on a Bioanalyzer (Agilent). Samples were then sequenced on a MiSeq platform (Illumina) at 760X mean coverage. :: PMID: 31347788

Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). WGA

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics) with a custom amplicon panel targeting 25 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supporting Information Table S1). The quality of the libraries was assessed on a Bioanalyzer (Agilent). Samples were then sequenced on a MiSeq platform (Illumina) at 760X mean coverage. :: PMID: 31347788

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

RNA and DNA library construction for RNA and whole-exome DNA sequencing was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions using the Illumina TruSeq RNA sample preparation V2 and Nextera rapid capture exome kits, respectively. Sequencing was completed on the Illumina HiSeq 2000 according to the manufacturer's instructions. :: PMID: 34939322
WGA

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Samples were multiplexed using the MULTISeq approach on three lanes of the 10X Chromium scRNASeq platform. Target coverage was 2000 cells per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

design_description: Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Samples were multiplexed using the MULTISeq approach on three lanes of the 10X Chromium scRNASeq platform. Target coverage was 2000 cells per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.
RNA-Seq

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

WGA

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Samples were multiplexed using the MULTISeq approach on three lanes of the 10X Chromium scRNASeq platform. Target coverage was 2000 cells per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

file_description: Decoder file to indicate which samples are in which batchmultiplex file  and the barcode for the sample.

design_description: Samples were multiplexed using the MULTISeq approach on three lanes of the 10X Chromium scRNASeq platform. Target coverage was 2000 cells per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

RNA-Seq

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265
DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

WGA

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics) with a custom amplicon panel targeting 25 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supporting Information Table S1). The quality of the libraries was assessed on a Bioanalyzer (Agilent). Samples were then sequenced on a MiSeq platform (Illumina) at 760X mean coverage. :: PMID: 31347788

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Samples were multiplexed using the MULTISeq approach on three lanes of the 10X Chromium scRNASeq platform. Target coverage was 2000 cells per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

Briefly, ribosomal RNA was removed from total RNA using QIAseq FastSelect rRNA HMR Kit (Qiagen, Catalog# 334387). After the depletion of rRNA, cDNA library preparation was carried out including RNA fragmentation, cDNA synthesis, ligation of index adaptors, and amplification, following the KAPA RNA Hyper Prep Kit Technical Data Sheet, KR0961 – v3.15 (Roche Corporate, Catalog #KK8541). Each resulting indexed library was quantified and its quality accessed by Agilent TapeStation, and multiple libraries were pooled in equal molarity. The library pool was then sequenced in 100b paired-end read format on a NovaSeq 6000 (Illumina, Inc.).

Genomic DNA (300 ng) was bisulfite-converted using the TrueMethyl oxBS module according to the manufacturer's protocol (Tecan). Converted ssDNA was quantified using the Qubit ssDNA Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and 100 ng was used as input for the custom-made Targeted MethylSeq Assay (Tecan). Final libraries were quality checked using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kit (Agilent) and quantified using the Qubit HS Assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific) before pooling for next-generation sequencing. Single-index library pools were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 4000 with paired-end 150 bp mode.

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

Total RNA was extracted from PB or BM samples using the Qiagen AllPrep kit and was used to prepare mRNA libraries. Target coverage was 40e6 paired end reads per sample. Libraries were prepared for 75-bp strand-specific paired-end sequencing using the ribodepletion v2.0 protocol by the British Columbia Genome Sciences Center (BCGSC, Vancouver, BC). Libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500.

DNA samples were sequenced using a custom amplicon-based targeted sequencing approach. Libraries were prepared (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA) using 20ng (for Guthrie cards) or 10ng (for diagnosis samples) of genomic DNA per primer pool targeting 26 genes in total that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplemental Table 1). Libraries were assessed by Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA) and sequenced on a HiSeq 4000 (Illumina, San Diego, CA). FASTQ reads were trimmed with fastp to remove amplicon primer sequences and adapters then aligned using BWA5,. Variants called with VarScan23. Total mean and median coverage per alteration site examined in BAM files was 39,500× and 38,000x respectively. Minimum depth of ≥ 100 reads and ≥ 10 alternate reads were required to call alterations. Mean and median unique reads per mutation was 6,600x and 6,400x respectively.  :: PMID: 34183765

DNA samples (32 from the technical cohort and 47 from the independent validation cohort) were sequenced using a custom amplicon panel (Paragon Genomics, Hayward, CA, USA), targeting 26 genes that are recurrently mutated in JMML (Supplementary Methods Table 1). Ten nanograms of genomic DNA were used for each library and were processed according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Library quality was assessed using the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Analysis kit (Agilent, Santa Clara, CA, USA) and quantified using the Qubit HS assay (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA). Dual-index libraries were sequenced on an Illumina MiSeq instrument using the 150 bp PE mode. Mean on-target sequencing depth was 1519x (median = 1297x). :: PMID: 33139265

Whole exome sequencing was performed utilizing the Illumina platform as described previously. In brief, DNA was fragmented by sonication (Covaris Inc., Woburn, MA) to 150 bp and further purified using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Fifty ng of size-selected DNA was then ligated to specific adaptors during library preparation (Illumina TruSeq, Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). Each library was made with sample-specific barcodes and quantified by quantitative PCR (Kapa Biosystems, Inc., Woburn, MA), and two libraries were pooled to a total of 500 ng for exome enrichment using the Agilent SureSelect hybrid capture kit (Whole Exome_v1.1; Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA). Several captures were pooled further and sequenced in one or more lanes to a final equivalent of two exomes per lane on a HiSeq 2500 system (Illumina Inc., San Diego, CA). :: PMID: 26457647

Single cell gene expression analysis was conducted using a 10X Chromium single cell system (10X Genomics, Inc) and a NovaSeq 6000 sequencer (Illumina, Inc). Five to ten thousand targeted cell recovery per sample with viability of >75% was applied to a single cell master mix with lysis buffer and reverse transcription reagents, following the Chromium NextGEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits User Guide, CG000204 Rev D (10X Genomics, Inc). The quality of cDNA and library was examined by Bioanalyzer and Qubit. The resulting libraries were pooled in equal molarity and sequenced in a custom program for 28b plus 91b paired-end sequencing on Illumina NovaSeq 6000.
